headline: Classic Meatloaf
description: Chef John's traditional meatloaf recipe uses classic ingredients like sautéed vegetables, spices, and bread crumbs. An old-fashioned glaze adds flavor to every slice.
name: Classic Meatloaf
recipeIngredient: 0.5 medium red bell pepper, coarsely chopped
1 teaspoon Sriracha sauce, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line a baking dish with lightly greased foil.
Place carrot, celery, onion, bell pepper, mushrooms, and garlic in a food processor; pulse until very finely chopped, almost to a purée. Transfer to a large mixing bowl.

Add ground chuck to the vegetables, along with Worcestershire sauce, egg, Italian herbs, salt, black pepper, and cayenne. Mix gently with a wooden spoon until ingredients are just combined. Sprinkle in bread crumbs and gently mix with your fingertips until just combined; don't overmix.
Shape the mixture into a loaf, about 4 inches high by 6 inches across. Place in the prepared baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven just until the meatloaf is hot, about 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, stir brown sugar, ketchup, Dijon, and Sriracha for glaze in a small bowl until brown sugar has dissolved.
Remove meatloaf from the oven. Spoon glaze on the top of the meatloaf with the back of a spoon, then pull a tiny bit glaze down the sides.

Return to the oven, and bake until no longer pink inside, 45 to 75 more minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the loaf should read at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), so start checking at 45 minutes and continue baking until meatloaf reaches that temperature. Cooking time will depend on shape and thickness of the meatloaf.

review.reviewBody: It was so delicious. I will make it again. I added Heinz 57 and extra oregano. I baked it at 375 for 60 min.

Delicious. I upped the amount of sriracha sauce so it was nice and spicey. Next time I won't put the beef mixture in aluminum foil. The juices made it difficult to remove the loaf from the pan. I also baked longer than the time specified.

Made this for the first time tonight. Only subs I had were bagel chips (crushed) instead of breadcrumbs and left out the cayenne. I will agree with some of the other comments for cooking time. I used a loaf pan and it took about 1hr and 30 min. We enjoyed it a lot and would def have it again.
This is my go-to meatloaf recipe. My family loves it.

This is a very tasty meatloaf recipe but I made a few changes. I like a more tomato-y flavored glaze so I doubled up on the ketchup and reduced the mustard by half. I also note that the updated recipe no longer indicates a 45 minute baking time. I had already discovered it has to cook for 1:15 - 1:30.

I loved this meatloaf!!! So much flavor. I am not a fan of mushrooms so I left those out. I like veggies so I used a grater to shred the 2 carrots and 2 celery stalks. I tried to fine chop a whole red bell pepper. I used a food processor to chop a whole onion and 3 cloves of garlic. My meatloaf does show a lot of veggies, but I really like veggies.
Very moist. I used Ritz and didn’t have any mushrooms on hand. I really wanted to add some catsup but this was perfect without it.

I followed the directions, but eliminated mushrooms since I didn't have them. Overall, it was ok. I was disappointed at how bland the meat was. The sauce on top was a nice mixture and had a unique flavor, which we enjoyed. But if I took a bite of just the meat alone without the sauce, it was bland. I also had to cook it way less than what was suggested. I did like the addition of the chopped veggies though. I think I'll continue my quest for the perfect meatloaf.
I added 1/2 cup of cour cream and used tollhouse crackers because I didn't have breadcrumbs and this meatloaf came out super moist and delicious!
Excellent

It is a very flavorful and moist meatloaf. I saw a couple comments say it didn't cook in 45 minutes, mine was done at 45 minutes. I did cook it in a 13x9 pan on aluminum foil approximately 6"x4" loaf almost the length of the pan. It was 161° when I pulled it out. I didn't use glaze in recipie, I use hienz chili sauce, as that's what my Mom always used on meatloaf.

In our search for the perfect meatloaf, we've probably tried 50 different recipes over the years. I'm happy to say the search is over. This is it. No need for ketchup or milk to moisten the mixture. No packaged soup mixes. The veggies do the job, making the loaf moist and extremely flavorful. We don't care for a glazed meatloaf, so didn't make it. Deducted one star because the cooking time was wrong. Baked at 325 for 45 minutes, not more than 125 degrees, so switched to convection at 350 for an additional 20 mins. To sum up: Best. Meatloaf. Ever. (except for the cook time!)

My family really likes this recipe. I did not have carrots on hand, but we didn't miss them. I also used approx. 1.75 lb. ground round and .5 lb of ground pork instead of all ground beef - this is just a personal preference of mine. I small diced all the vegetables which is quicker for me than using the food processor. I also felt the baking time was off as noted by others. I baked it at 350 for about 45-50 minutes. Took it out at 155 degrees and let it sit tented for about 5 minutes. It turned out great. This is a new favorite of ours.
Excellent turns out great every time!
It was good I used 85/15 meat, and well it was really greasy, the breadcrumbs really soaked up the juice and grease, I couldn't eat it will try with better meat!

I did make a couple of changes. I added an envelope of onion soup mix and omitted the Worcestershire and cayenne pepper. It was absolutely delicious. I didn't even check about the amount of time it was supposed to cook. But I cooked the 2lb meatloaf for an hour and 15 minutes. My husband loved it! I also used garlic flavored Ritz crackers instead of the bread crumbs..Amazing!!!

I can’t believe I haven’t reviewed this before. This is my go to meatloaf recipe. I make it as instructed, occasionally substituting the ground chuck for deer or moose. My entire family loves it (even the picky eater). It’s also great that there are lots of veggies cooked right in. 
As many reviewers stated, it does take longer to cook. Closer to two hours. I sometimes will even do it on the Traeger. 
Thanks again Chef John.

Very, very good ! I followed the recipe EXCEPT, after making a sort of puree of the veggies in my food processor, I added the egg, Worcestershire, herbs, salt, pepper and cayenne pepper and pulsed it a couple of additional times in order to make sure these ingredients would be well mixed throughout, too. I didn't see any "downside" to doing that.

Next time, I'll add more onion (one whole medium onion), another tbsp or so of Worcestershire sauce and maybe some hot sauce to the blend of veggies in the food processor. 

It would be just fine without the glaze which wasn't wonderful - I'll experiment with that next time.

It took quite a bit longer to cook than the recipe suggested.
I've made this many times and it's always delicious. I always halve the recipe because I'm cooking for myself. I use 50/50 chuck and pork and use the cooking time for a full recipe.
I used half red BBQ sauce with have yellow mustard BBQ sauce!

This meatloaf is the best!!! As far as cook time… it would definitely depend on how you shape the meatloaf (narrow or wider) - that is a common sense issue . I don’t want to offend anybody… But man… I look at these recipes as guides and mostly for ingredients… I let my common sense take over. I don’t think this recipe deserves a one star review just because somebody screwed up the cook time. That is harsh!!
I didn't care for it. It was ok but not what I was looking for.
This was delicious and so moist.
Very yummy, and the kids had no idea there were veggies in it!
Perfect! Just make sure you use a pan with 1/2 inch or more extra room in the pan on all sides!
I’m a simple man so I didn’t change a thing. Instant mash and a can of peas. Did make gravy with meatloaf drippings. Water gravy! Old old school

Timing Issue: I made it exactly as it was in the video and instructions (NOT in a loaf pan) and the internal temperature after 40 minutes post-glaze was only 107. And that was with convection, which generally cooks faster. So the timing is WAY off. Perhaps it's my oven? Though I don't recall any other times when my oven cooked far too cool/slow, especially not a consistent problem. So either the time is way too short or the temperature is too low, or both. I cooked it an additional 15 minutes, then turned it up to 350 because that didn't do nearly enough and gave it another 27 minutes to reach 160. So overall, it took 1 hr and 37 minutes, mostly at 325 then at 350. There were several times that I took it out to test the temp, so that impacted it as well, but for most people, I'd say it's safe to just cook at 350 (from the start) for an hour post-glaze.

Luckily I was just cooking for myself tonight, and not others! The timing would have been unfortunate.

Aside from the timing and temperature issue, the recipe tastes good. All of the best meatloaf recipes I've made have vegetable puree in them. It just takes the flavor to new levels somehow, and they are always so moist. The flavor in this one was good, but the moisture was not there. I mean, it wasn't super dry, but I think the long cooking time impacted the texture for sure. The glaze on this one is quite good--I like my meatloaf on the sweet side.

So this recipe lost a star for the super weird timing/temp, and another sta
This is very good, I’ll definitely make it again
I changed the cook time to 350 degrees 1 hour 15 minutes. Other than that, tasted great! Thanks!

I used what I had so the main difference was only 1.5 lbs beef and no mushroom. I substituted balsamic vinegar instead of Worcestershire. I grated the veggies on a cheese grater and they were perfect! This meatloaf was moist and full of flavor. I did 20+40 minutes in the oven. I used foil but next time I’ll use parchment paper as it still stuck to the foil even though I used olive oil to grease. Will definitely make this again!
Regardless of cook time, the recipe is delicious!!!

Yummy meatloaf.
I followed the recipe and planned to make them in a muffin tin until I found a mini loaf pan in my pantry. 
This made 8 little loaves of about 5 oz. each. Just the right serving size for the adults.
The food processor is essential to get the veggies just right to add to the mix.
(my carrot chunks were a little too big)
Baked a directed about 40 minutes.
this is delicious, i made it with a spicy kick!

This meatloaf was delicious. Although, I made a couple of adjustments. I skipped the celery and added green onions. I would probably use less brown sugar for the glaze next time, I'm not a fan of sweet and savory. But other than that it was easy to make and it was a hit!
Excellent recipe just as it is!
I’ve made this recipe many times since discovering it. It freezes well, makes great leftovers and sandwiches. We love it!

Did I really just give a Chef John recipe only two stars? Cannot believe it but we really did not care for this. Not crazy about the prep that did not seem to add much to the whole. The timing depended on the size and shape but using a probe to reach 160 it did came out nice and moist but the taste was blah! His “Meatball Inspired” (what use to be his “Prison Style”) Meatloaf is way way better. Sorry Chef John. I guess you are human after all. Not every recipe is perfect!

I used the recipe to get the basic proportions for the meat and breadcrumbs and was pleasantly surprised by the overall outcome, using the spices and glaze recommended. The only variation I made was to use half 'meatloaf' mix from the grocery store meat dept b/c I had already bought it. I added ground sirloin to it and it was delicious.

I made this exactly as written but I left out the peppers because I didn’t have any. I also put it in a loaf pan. I checked the temp after 45 minutes and it was not done so I put it bake in for 15 and by then it had reached 160. We loved the results! Chef John is my hero!
Followed as written. My family loved it.
Good stuff. Will make is again. The aroma that filled our home while it was baking was heavenly.

This has become my go-to meatloaf. It’s sooo yummy! Other reviewers have given it one star because they say the cook time is “off...” NOT TRUE if you follow the instructions. Shape the loaf as directed; don’t bake in a loaf pan. It comes out perfect every time. Don’t be afraid to try this GREAT meatloaf recipe!
did not care for it. Sorry.

I’ve been making meatloaf for years but like to change it up occasionally. The flavor of this meatloaf was great. Mincing the veggies in a processor made a huge difference in the moistness of the meat. I made recipe as written. The cayenne definitely kicked it up a notch. I also put a shot of hot sauce into the glaze. The spiciness of the meatloaf may be a turn-off to kids. 4 stars because the cooking time was off. After cooking for 55 minutes at 325 meat temperature was 116. Turned oven up to 350 and cooked for another 1/2 hour which brought it up to 160.

My new favorite recipe for meatloaf! I left out the mushrooms because I didn't have on hand. I also doubled the ingredients for the glaze. Husband noticed right away it was not my same old one for the last 45 years. He gave 5 stars. My last favorite meatloaf was the one I grew up on from Mom. This is better, but I won't tell her that.
out of mushrooms, but still delecious
Better than I knew meatloaf could be!

I have made this meatloaf twice using only 2lbs of grass fed ground beef. I agree with others that the cooking time is hugely off. typically I cook a meatloaf at 400 deg for an hour and it's perfectly cooked through with a nice crust. I have one in the oven as I speak and have not varied the ingredients, but you can bet it will take longer than the recipe calls for. Otherwise, it's very delicious and moist.
This was pretty amazing for meatloaf. I overcooked it a bit, but it still came out moist and tender. I will use a bit less cayenne next time for those with a delicate pallet, lol.
I always hated meatloaf as a kid, but my husband is a carnivore, so I gave a try for something new to have. Loved it so much I’m eating the leftovers for lunch right now!
Made it just as the directions said and it was AMAZING!! Definitely a new dish added to the meal rotation!!! Yay!
Delicious, with a black peppery kick!
i used cauliflower instead of mushrooms and my kids loved it. ill definitely do it again.

I used half of the portion and the meatloaf was very moist and tasty. I skipped white mushrooms. For the sauce, I forgot to put Worcestershire sauce in the meat mix so I used Dark Soy sauce for the sauce on top. The result was good. It was very easy to make. The instruction was very easy to follow. I'd make this again and probably use baby bella instead of white mushrooms. Thank you chef John.
I love the vegetables in this recipe. I added 1/2 cup shredded zucchini and an extra egg to help bind everything together. It is my famlies new favorite meatloaf recipe.
Best meatloaf I have ever eaten!

very good. did not puree onions, carrots, etc; diced and mixed in, meatloaf more 'chunky.' flavor wonderful, moist. used meatloaf pan; came out well, we all loved it. will make again. consider doubling the glaze; it was delicious.thank you!
I followed this recipe to a "T" except I only used 2 lbs of ground beef. A little more work than other meatloafs I've made, but this was the best tasting I've ever made. Saved to favorites!

So flavorful! The puréed veggies definitely make a difference! I didn’t have celery but it was still delicious. I took everyone’s advice and cooked it longer for about 1.5 hours at 350. Next time I’ll try 325 because the top of the load was a bit hard.
I didn't make the sauce for the top. The meatloaf is very moist and this is a great recipe for getting extra veggies into a meal.
Great recipe. Easy and fast!

I am not a cook therefore I am not a good cook. I made this meatloaf for my family and they enjoyed it very much. It was a very easy recipe to follow and I loved that the instructions were accompanied by a video (that was not long and drawn out). Unfortunately the meatloaf broke apart after I cut it and attempted to plate it. That just means I will have to make this again to try and correct that. Thanks Chef John!
Excellent

My husband doesn't like meatloaf, but he absolutely raved about this one. That is huge for him.
Mary M
added oats
Turned out very good. The gravy is made with Troegs Troegenator doublebock

Made it once and loved it. The glaze in particular is perfect; careful with how much hot sauce you use. I used Tabasco with a few drops. Doing it again today, great for sandwich leftovers or any salad accompaniment or vegetable.
Excellent recipe! My husband thought it was the best ever! I baked it at 350 for over an hour. It was crisp on the outside and moist in the center with lots of flavor.
I give this 5 stars - best recipe for meatloaf I've ever made. My husband agreed!
This was delicious. And it did take much longer to cook but you stated it might take longer depending on the loaf and pan. I wouldn't leave 1 star just for that. Thank you it was so good.

Love this meatloaf. I made this ahead and frozen into individual meals for my lunches and dinner. It was great fresh and there was no difference in taste when I froze and reheated for my lunch. The glaze is amazing. I've never put hot sauce (tabasco) in my glaze. It gave it just the right touch. Also, the minced vegetables was a first too. Everything was great! This is now one of my scheduled make-ahead meals. Try it, you will love it.
I made it the first time as is--I got compliments from husband and guests"the best meatloaf I ever had".
I basically followed the recipe, adding additional dried herbs and less mustard. I was surprised how much the coating added to the dish, but ultimately, I felt it was a little bland.

Read others' reviews and increased temp to 350 F to start (30 mins). Added glaze, decreased temp to 325 and baked for another 20 mins.
Didn't have Worcestershire so added milk instead. Easy cleanup. Very tasty and will make again!
Excellent as per recipe !

I like all the recipes from Chef John. This one is a keeper, too. Really liked all the vegetables in it as “filler” without all the bread. I didn’t have any breadcrumbs or crackers, so I used some herb seasoned stuffing (Pepperidge Farm) and it was just fine. The sauce was easy to make and very tasty. This meatloaf is surprisingly low cal - the veggie filler again. Chef John’s mushroom gravy recipe with mashed potatoes was 5 stars. The only reason I didn’t give the meatloaf 5 stars was because the loaf pan was quite full of water - I suppose from all the veggies. I’ll use a bigger loaf pan next time so I can drain the water. Pure comfort food - and I will make it again!!

Bake time is way off. Takes closer to 2 hours.
Split up your instructions when they involve multiple steps!
This is now my go-to for meatloaf. I even make it in our Ninja Foodi!
Best meatloaf I've ever tasted! My husband loves it and even my picky eaters gobbled it all up! I'll never make it any other way again!
Awesome meatloaf! Moist and flavorful - Chef John doesn't disappoint. I made a few adjustments based solely on personal taste, but the recipe is very good as written.
Easy and delicious. This is my third time and each time is better than last.
This recipe is wonderful as is, no need to substitute anything.
This recipe is wonderful as is, no need to substitute anything.

I'm never rated a recipe or anything else for that matter but I gotta say this changed my go to meatloaf recipe forever!
The only change was to replace ¼ of the beef with ground pork, only out of necessity, it's what I had.
I had to keep it in the oven a little longer than suggested but that was to please certain guests ;)
Thanks Chef John, I use a lot of your recipes!

Skipped the glaze, had to cook longer than recipe stated (not the big deal for me as it is for others), best meatloaf I ever made, and if I have had better, it been such a long time ago I can't recall it.

My family Loved it!! Can’t wait for tomorrow meatloaf sandwiches (leftovers)! Saved this recipe for next time soon!!
Made it again !! Our fav!!
I made a few small variations such as omitted the cayenne pepper and used my own seasoning, but this is by far my favorite recipe for meatloaf!
Never making meatloaf any other way!

I really enjoyed this recipe and I noted in the comments the disparity in estimated cooking time versus actual cook time. I did not have this problem but the shape of mine wasn't nearly as thick, only about as high as the width of my hand (basically child size fyi). I learned from my mother to always put an indent in the middle of meatloaf for more even cooking as well, that made a huge difference. The indent was roughly half an inch deep and ran down the middle, leaving the full height of loaf on the entire perimeter. I put the loaf in for the initial 15 minutes and then glazed it with equal parts, brown sugar, dijon, and chili sauce and only a tiny squirt of ketchup. The sweetness of ketchup can be overwhelming and the zing of chili sauce contrasted nicely with the sugar. It was only in the oven for another 20 minutes, 35 in total. I let it rest as I was finishing my potatoes and it was perfect. Juicy, and only the barest touch of pink in the thickest spots. Unfortunately no pictures, but the uncooked loaf was probably 7.5-8 inches wide and about two thirds the length of a 13x9 pan to give an idea of why my cook time was so limited. I will definitely be making this again in the future.

Everyone loves this meatloaf. It has great flavor and the sauce on top is delicious.
I make it all the time.

I read reviews, watched the video then followed the recipe except for the glaze. I changed ketchup from 2 to 3 tablespoons, mustard from 2 to 1, and a little less sugar. I followed instructions exactly as given. My meatloaf cooked perfectly. It was moist and the texture was perfect. Rating could be 5, gave 4 because the amount for vegetables is not a measurement. I wondered if the amount of vegetables I used was correct. Think I'll try more next time. The recipe is a keeper.

Wonderful recipe, very moist but held together.
I used my Italian gravy that I had on hand, as a topping. I also threw in three big Calabrese sausages to spice it up.
On Keto so used gluten free panko crumbs instead of regular bread crumbs.
This is now my go to meatloaf tecipe.
No changes made and will definitely make again. It was delicious.
So moist and flavorful. Tend to have most of the ingredients making it an even nicer experience .
It's really tasty! The grandchildren loved it too and did not realize the veggies were present. Gonna do this one again.

This was so tasty! I am going 2 weeks without bread and pasta to see what I notice so I needed some good recipes. I left out the flour and added 1 small Zucchini to the veggie list and 2 eggs instead of one. I baked it 1 ½ hrs at 350 because of the comments I saw and it turned out perfectly. My whole family gobbled it up. Will definitely make it again

A little too spicy!
I will reduce the cayenne pepper next time. 
I did not have a good processor So the shredded carrots stayed along with the diced peppers and onion. 
Will have to re think this recipe next time.

Made it with Chef John’s Mushroom Gravy and some mashed potatoes on the side. Delicious! Did what everyone else did and baked at 350 for about an hour and it was perfect!the cayenne pepper does add a little kick as your eating. I’ll probably omit next time since my family isn’t a fan of spice, but overall we loved it!

I grated a Potato for added texture. Used two eggs since I used 2 lbs ground round and pork mince combined .
My Grandchildren love this.
